oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Survey of veterinary student attitudes toward animal welfare and pain
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Martin, M. S.
Baysinger, A.
Viscardi, A.
Kleinhenz, M.
Edwards-Callaway, L.
Johnstone, E.
Coetzee, J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: painfulness of procedures
analgesia
pain
animal welfare
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Discrepancies in the background and training of veterinarians regarding the painfulness of procedures across species may impact their decision to use analgesia. The objective of this study was to investigate veterinary student attitudes toward pain and animal welfare.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2019; 352
